title: Virtual Laboratory-Based Project Learning Design for Engineering Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Engineering Principles and Experimental Methods
context.additional_context: Focus on cultivating real-life problem-solving skills through team-based projects in BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environments

learning_goals: After completing three engineering projects (bridge design, circuit assembly, fluid dynamics experiments) in virtual (PhET simulation) and physical laboratories (mechanical assembly kits), learners quantitatively analyze a mean score difference of 1.5 or more on a 5-point Likert scale participation survey between virtual and physical environments.
They derive at least three learner motivation factors when designing virtual lab-based projects.

In a 4-person team project, learners develop three evaluation criteria for individual contribution assessment—'number of idea proposals (≥5 times)', 'material preparation completeness (≥80%)', 'collaboration attitude (feedback implementation rate ≥70%)'—and achieve over 80% consensus (average ≥8/10 scale) among team members using the applied evaluation form.
Over 80% of learners achieve the ability to apply engineering theory knowledge to virtual lab projects.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
